column4: Hi all... Can somebody tell me how I can change the default text editor (in bash)? It's set to Nano/Pico/Maxi/Medi to default, and I'm really longing for vi... pls help?
you change the EDITOR environment variable
and that is normally set in one of .bashrc or .bash_profile (assuming you're _using_ bash)
Doesn't exist in .bashrc, or /etc/bash.bashrc. I'm running gutsy b.t.w. Do you know for certain it's not somewhere else?
not entirely sure, but I _added_ mine.
Ah... thanx, will do that too!
in my case,    export EDITOR=/usr/bin/vim   <== though you could possibly leave off the /usr/bin/
it's working, thanx a lot mate!
you'll also find that PAGER is useful too, I set that to "less"
pager kicks in whenever you display a file via man
for a LOT of unix or UNIX-lookalikes, the original PAGER was "more"
cool! Well... we all know Less is more ;)
heh. And I can't even START xfwm4 on my remote X session. Or, at least one machine it'll work, the other it won't.
